socialSecurityDeathIndex

Class SSDIprogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialSecurityDeathIndex.SSDIprogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SSDIprogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Simple client program for loading the master files and executing queries
    Author:
    Jim Vlcek
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • Default

        public static SSDIprogram Default()
        Named constructor for access to SSDI program singleton instance
        Returns:
        the single, default instance of the SSDI program

      • Connect

        public void Connect()
        Connect to a database of the currently-selected type ("Sponsor")

      • Disconnect

        public void Disconnect()
        Disconnect the current active connection, if one exists and is currently in a connected state

      • LoadMasterFile

        public void LoadMasterFile()
        Loads a Social Security Death Index master file, optionally adding records, as they are read in, to a connected database

      • MatchRecord

        public IDeathRecord MatchRecord(long lSSAN)
        Query the connected database for a record matching a specified Social Security Account Number
        Parameters:
        lSSAN - the Social Security Account Number to query for matching records
        Returns:
        the matching Death Index record, if one is found, otherwise null

      • getIsConnected

        public java.lang.Boolean getIsConnected()
        Gets the database connection status of the program
        Returns:
        true if the program is connected to a database, otherwise false

      • getAddRecords

        public java.lang.Boolean getAddRecords()
        Gets the value of the "add records on read" option
        Returns:
        true if the user has opted to add Death Index records to the database as they are read in from a master file

      • setAddRecords

        public void setAddRecords(java.lang.Boolean addRecords)
        Sets or clears the "add records on read" option
        Parameters:
        addRecords - the desired state of the option: true to add records to the database as they are read in from a master false, or false to discard the records after reading them

      • getDatabasePort

        public int getDatabasePort()
        Gets the port number the database server is expected to be listening on
        Returns:
        the expected port number

      • setDatabasePort

        public void setDatabasePort(int databasePort)
        Sets the port number the database server is expected to be listening on
        Parameters:
        databasePort - the expected port number

      • getDatabaseType

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseType()
        Gets a String identifier of the database to be connected. This identifier is associated with the "sponsor" (MySQL, SQL Server, etc.) of the database, and not with the database server's URL.
        Returns:
        the identifier String for the database sponsor

      • setDatabaseType

        public void setDatabaseType(java.lang.String databaseType)
        Sets the String identifier of the database to be connected.
        Parameters:
        databaseType - the identifier String for the database sponsor
